clinical_summary: On 2025-05-28, a complete blood count showed hemoglobin 135 g/dL, RBC 5.05 million/µL, hematocrit 41.3 %, MCV 81.8 fL (slightly below reference), MCH 26.7 pg (slightly below), normal WBC 8200 cells/µL with differential within limits, and platelet count 3.4 ×10⁵/µL; peripheral smear was reported normal. On 2025-08-01, inflammatory markers were low (CRP 1.8 mg/dL, procalcitonin 0.13 ng/mL), total bilirubin 1.4 mg/dL and direct bilirubin 0.6 mg/dL were mildly elevated, while ALT 10 U/L and AST 12 U/L were normal; WBC 7500 cells/µL with neutrophils 58 % remained normal, and peripheral smear again noted normal morphology.

differential_diagnoses.name: Mild conjugated hyperbilirubinemia (early cholestasis or benign bilirubin elevation)
differential_diagnoses.justification: Direct bilirubin 0.6 mg/dL is above the reference range while transaminases are normal

differential_diagnoses.name: Iron deficiency or thalassemia trait
differential_diagnoses.justification: MCV 81.8 fL and MCH 26.7 pg are slightly below reference despite normal hemoglobin

differential_diagnoses.name: Absence of active infection or sepsis
differential_diagnoses.justification: CRP 1.8 mg/dL, procalcitonin 0.13 ng/mL, and WBC counts are within normal limits
